Search Password Managers
Search the database of password managers to see legacy functionality

Results

1Password

Emergency Kit
Password Sharing
Overview
Website: https://1password.com/
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: Yes
Password sharing functionality: Yes
Emergency Kit Functionality
Contents of the emergency kit:
  • Sign in address
  • Email address
  • Secret Key
  • Option to write your master password
  • QR code
Emergency Kit Documentation
Password Sharing Functionality
Types of accounts that can share items: None (copy to Shared)
Types of accounts that can share folders: Families, Teams, Business or Enterprise accounts
Password Sharing Documentation
Export formats
  • csv
  • txt
  • 1pif (1Password 4 only)
Notes
  • Teams and Families accounts feature account recovery functionality. A person who has lost access to their account may recreate their account and recover access to a shared vault via another member of the family/team. You can recover accounts for other people if you’re a family organizer, you’re a team administrator or owner, or you belong to a group that has the “Recover Accounts” permission. The person whose account is to be recovered will need access to the email account associated with their 1Password account. Learn more here: https://support.1password.com/recovery/
  • If you have a membership with 1password or belong to a family or team account, your emergency kit will contain your secret key, and a place to write your master password. Learn more about what your secret key is here: https://support.1password.com/secret-key/
  • You may want to keep a copy of the emergency kit (with master password) with your will, or give it to someone you trust.
  • You may want to keep your master password written somewhere separate to your secret key

Apple Keychain

Overview
Website: https://support.apple.com/en-gb/HT204085
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: Partial
Password Sharing Functionality
Types of accounts that can share items: All, but via airdrop only (over WiFi or bluetooth to other Apple devices)
Types of accounts that can share folders: None
Password Sharing Documentation
Export formats
  • Encrypted file only usable by Apple Keychain
Notes
  • Some workarounds have been developed to export passwords to .csv format, for example see this thread: https://gist.github.com/rmondello/b933231b1fcc83a7db0b
  • Third-party apps may be available to assist in exporting passwords into shareable formats, for example see this article: https://appletoolbox.com/easily-export-your-passwords-from-icloud-keychain-with-this-script/

Ascendo DataVault

Overview
Website: http://ascendo.co/support.html
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Export formats
  • 'Standard text formats'
Notes
  • There is functionality to backup passwords onto Dropbox. It may be possible to backup to a shared folder and leave the password to this file in a safe place to be passed to the executor of the will or other assigned data steward

Avast Passwords

Overview
Website: https://support.avast.com/en-gb/article/Passwords-FAQ
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Export formats
  • To .csv via Google Chrome (using unofficial workaround: https://support.avast.com/en-gb/article/Export-Google-Chrome-Passwords-data)
Notes

Notes

Blur Passwords

Overview
Website: https://dnt.abine.com/#feature/passwords
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: Partial
Password sharing functionality: No
Emergency Kit Functionality
Contents of the emergency kit:
  • Backup passphrase
Emergency Kit Documentation
Export formats
  • csv
Notes
  • Blur provides a locally generated backup passphrase that can be used to restore access to the account. Use of this feature requires both the knowledge of the passphrase and also access to the user's email inbox. As such, use of this feature to provide emergency or post-mortem access will require email access/credentials to be made available separately as well.

Bitwarden

Overview
Website: https://bitwarden.com/
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Export formats
  • JSON
  • csv
Notes
  • Emergency contact functionality is a requested feature, and the progress can be tracked here: https://community.bitwarden.com/t/emergency-access/115/69. Given the popularity of the request, it is likely the feature will be implemented in the near future.

LastPass

Emergency Contact
Password Sharing
Overview
Website: www.lastpass.com
Emergency contact functionality: Yes
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: Yes
Emergency Contact Functionality
Mechanism: Triggered by assigned emergency contact
Granularity: Full access to all credentials
Number of contacts possible: One or more
Types of accounts that can give access: Premium or Families
Types of accounts that can receive access: Any
Emergency Contact Documentation
Password Sharing Functionality
Types of accounts that can share items: Any
Types of accounts that can share folders: Families, Teams or Enterprise/Identity accounts
Password Sharing Documentation
Export formats
  • csv
  • xml
Notes
  • Recipient must accept, and then the granting account must confirm before the emergency contact setup is complete. This means that accepting the role of emergency contact must take place before the need for access arises.
  • Details on how the emergency contact functionality is secure is available here https://support.logmeininc.com/lastpass/help/how-is-emergency-access-secure
